item.title: Over growing shrubs, 13th June
item.description:
The trees and shrubs are encroaching over the entire footpath making it difficult to walk past others, particularly students on their way to Babington School without having to walk in the road. This is along Elmstead Lane near the junction with Wood Drive.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Indoor Shisha, 13th June
item.description:
This is supposed to operate as a restaurant this is clearly a nightclub / Shisha spot. How is this place allowed to do Shisha indoors. The Health Act 2006 makes it illegal to smoke in enclosed places. Clearly the windows are tinted so no one knows

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wick Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Out side & opposite No 6, outside 14 outside 33, 13th June
item.description:
Road gullys full of debris. contributing to local flooding. This problem was reported several years ago with out result.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Murray Mews, Kentish Town, London

item.title: Bin not emptied, 13th June
item.description:
Tenant has moved out and left bins with overflowing rubbish. Not collected with general waste as contaminated. Can you please collect them as they smell and attracting many flys and remove the bins permanently. The bins should be be in front of the house as there is no fromy garden and they get moved up against parked cars causing damage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Lion Lane, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose household rubbish dumped by tree outside 74 Marne St, 13th June
item.description:
Neighbouring houses seem to think acceptable to dump loose items for bin/recycling collection. It's not! Been there since Tues eve!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Marne Street, Kensal Town, London

item.title: Watering, 13th June
item.description:
There are six new trees in Walden Road from Sandy Ridge to Yesterday Road. None of them seem to have been watered in this very dry period and the one nearest Yesterday Road is very stressed. Also the supports on the young Limes in the same area need to be adjusted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walden Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped furniture here for weeks, 13th June
item.description:
There is what looks lie a chest of drawers dumped outside 66 Amott Road, and it's been there for weeks! Could you please remove it? It looks like it's about to collapse and then become dangerous to the many kids that use this street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Amott Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle blocking pavement at junction, needs towing, 13th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E scooter bay lime bikes, road markings have been removed, 13th June
item.description:
Few weeks ago the road lines that were painted to show the e-scooter bay area have all been removed so now residents are parking there and the e scooter people are saying its still a valid bay. please can someone either update the app to confirm the bay is no longer for escooters or put the markings back ? It appears that the bay was moved to stuart road round the corner. so lots of confusion. thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elland Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cr Southhampton Row and High holborn, 13th June
item.description:
You have explained previously that this telephone box is privately owned and the owners have been made aware of the unsatisfactory situation. Clearly the owners donâ€™t care!! It is a complete mess, and looks terrible with the door hanging askew, a torn and broken curtain in front and obscene postcards on the sides. This is a main through fare to the British Museum and does not leave tourists with a good impression of London, in addition to being an eyesore to residents and workers in the area. Location - Corner High Holborn and Southhampton Row.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Row, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
